data.title: ParticleEmitter copy constructor does not copy imagepath
data.body:
### Effects

This breaks loadEmitterImages an a copy-constructed version of an ParticleEffect as the imagepath is used to load the textures of the emitters.
### Suggested solution

add

``` java
setImagePath(emitter.getImagePath());
```

to  ParticleEmitter(ParticleEmitter emitter)

data.title: Android backend resume() method early call
data.body: Android backend calls resume() method in ApplicationListener before phone will be locked. E. g. - we locked phone, pause() method was called. The we press "Power off" button, screen turns on, and resume() was called. But phone still is locked. My workaround was that I used Intent.ON_USER_PRESENT, but it isn't the best idea.

data.title: g3d: AnimationController.setAnimation() bug - animation is resetting to initial state at finish
data.body:
According to this wiki: 
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/3D-animations-and-skinning
model animation should freeze at the last frame.

"The setAnimation(String id) method will play the animation once at normal speed and then stop (freezing the animation at the last frame of the animation)."

As you can see here it's not true:
http://youtu.be/ZN0DXF312uA

This behaviour can be observed on stable 0.9.9 as well as latest nightly (06.12.2013)
in my own code as well as in Skeleton Test.

data.title: UBJsonReader: Use buffered streams
data.body: UBJsonReader performs a lot of single read operations, therefore using buffered inputs should speed up things.

data.title: MeshBuilder: dont assume indices are consecutive
Bug-fix: AssetManager loads ETC1 textures synchronously
data.body:
In it's loadAsync method TextureLoader calls ETC1TextureData and It only stores file handler for later loading with prepare() function which is only called in loadSync. So simple way to fix issue is to move this line:
if (!info.data.isPrepared()) info.data.prepare();
out of else clause to the end of loadAsync so it's always called. This also makes code on lines 69-72 redundant so it can be safely removed.

On a slightly related note, any thoughts on how asynchronous loading of ETC1 into Cubemap should be implemented? I don't see any solution that doesn't involve serious rewriting of AssetManager
Edit: Ok. I think I have found simple solution for this as well and that's to simply create TextureDataLoader class from TextureLoader.

data.title: Updated pom.xml to Android 4.4 + fixed issue tracker link
data.body: Changed android.version to 4.4 and changed issue link to github as the google code issue tracker has been replaced

data.title: Add method to obtain the width of the Window title text
data.body: To determine the minimum width of a Window (including buttons on the buttonBar), one needs to be able to obtain the width of the title text of the Window.

VehicleTest add volume to the ground

data.title: Bullet VehicleTest Not Working
data.body: A collision is occurring between the wheels and the ground immediately after loading the test. The Vehicle is unable to be moved.

data.title: Added UDP support to LibGDX
data.body:
Note: Missing support for GWT, but not sure if possible. Looking into
alternatives.

This adds the ability to use UDP datagrams in LibGDX. Complete with documentation.
Note: This creates it's own interface UDPSocket due to the inability to (easily) use Socket.java without some breakage

data.title: How to use touchevents in android live wallpapers?
Added a flip option to the BitmapFont section of Skin imports from JSON.
data.body: This allows the font to be flipped on the y-axis if necessary. Default is false (which was the previous behavior).  If the JSON does not contain the option, flipping on the y-axis will remain false.

data.title: Rendering to an FBO has its alpha hardcoded to 0
data.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Build code that uses a FBO
2. Set the fbos format to RGBA8888
3. Render a model to it using ModelBatch
4. Display the fbo to the screen using SpriteBatch

What is the expected output? 
I would expect to the model I rendered

What do you see instead?
Nothing

What version of libgdx are you using? If not using the master git
branch, please try that before filing a bug.

I am using the latest build

Please provide any additional information below.

Rendering to a transparent texture shows nothing.  I have posted this on the forums and talked to people on IRC but nobody can find a work around. Based on my testing I am concluding that when something is being rendered to a frame buffer it's alpha is always set to 0.  When the frame buffer is Formatted to RGB888 it renders fine as there is no alpha.  But when rendered to with RGBA8888, the entire FBO is 100% transparent.  Changing the glClearColor to (0,0,0,1) will show everything in the FBO expect a whole created by what was rendered to it.  I am pretty sure that the code rendering to the FBO is setting the alpha to 0 before it renders.  Another piece of evidence is that someone told me that using shaders will fix the problem.  I assume that works as you have control over the alpha yourself with shaders.

I am not sure how to attach the code to his tracker but I have posted the code in a couple of places

http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=11718
https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=1705&can=1&sort=-id

data.title: ETC1 loading on android
data.body:
Texture created with **Mali Texture Compression Tool v4.1.0** from a png file (1024*1024)

Then tried to open in an android app:

``` java
                FileHandle file = Gdx.files.internal("data/r_texture1024.pkm");
                ETC1.ETC1Data data = new ETC1.ETC1Data(file);
                ETC1TextureData td = new ETC1TextureData(data, false);
                texture = new Texture(td);
                texture.bind();

```

12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950): com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Couldn't load pkm file 'data/r_texture1024.pkm'
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ETC1$ETC1Data.<init>(ETC1.java:77)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at com.test.libgdx.SnowFall.create(SnowFall.java:98)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidGraphicsLiveWallpaper.onSurfaceChanged(AndroidGraphicsLiveWallpaper.java:424)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.guardedRun(GLSurfaceView.java:1505)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at android.opengl.GLSurfaceView$GLThread.run(GLSurfaceView.java:1240)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950): Caused by: java.io.IOException: unknown format (magic number 4b50)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream.<init>(GZIPInputStream.java:101)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at java.util.zip.GZIPInputStream.<init>(GZIPInputStream.java:81)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ETC1$ETC1Data.<init>(ETC1.java:67)
12-04 17:35:21.425: E/AndroidRuntime(3950):     ... 4 more

How can I load an ETC1 file normally? What is that "magic number"?:)

Thanks,
Leslie

data.title: Hide status bar tag missing from IOS template
data.body:
Hide status bar tag missing from IOS template, it must add this line to Info.plist.xml:

```
    <key>UIViewControllerBasedStatusBarAppearance</key>
    <false />
```

It's take me many hours to find the answer. This make game full screen on IOS

data.title: Restore actual viewport in FrameBuffer.end() method
data.body:
Restoring the screen size viewport in FrameBuffer.end() caused loosing of custom viewport (e.g. used for resolution independence) and duplication of glViewport call as workaround.
Changed restored viewport sizes to actual sizes acquired in FrameBuffer.begin() method.

data.title: LWJGL backend: glBufferData not executed with NULL data
data.body: This issue was brought up here and eventually marked as closed because unsolvable. However, taking a look at the latest LibGDX release, LWJGL now has a method glBufferData(int target, long data_size, int usage) specifically for passing NULL data and LibGDX should no longer throw an exception and call this method instead.

data.title: Documentation
data.body: I knew I forgot something, but I wasn't sure what until now. Sorry about that.

data.title: Workaround resume/pause deadlock in Android by killing
data.body:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/904

Repro steps:
1. Open libgdx app.
2. Open Android Recent Apps.
3. Double-tap Recent Apps with ~500ms between taps.
4. Tap Recent Apps once to bring libgdx app back -- if it comes back with no ANR, repeat steps 2-3.

As an interim bandaid we are killing the app if pause takes longer than 4 seconds (ANR is 5 seconds).

With this patch, the app closes during pause instead of ANRing.

data.title: Take into account Nexus 10 Framebuffer bug
data.body:
I've just stumbled upon this bug report:
http://community.arm.com/message/13156#13156

As a workaround Mali developer proposed to call glViewport _after_ glBindFramebuffer. As evident from FrameBuffer.java, libgdx does so in reverse order. Even though Mali guy says they fixed the bug in their most recent drivers, I suggest to swap the order nonetheless, cause better be safe than sorry.
